meanings.definition: To make musical sounds with the voice
meanings.sent1: She loves to sing along with her favorite songs.
meanings.sent2: The birds outside my window sing beautifully in the morning.
meanings.sent3: I tried to sing, but my voice cracked, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to sing through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The wind in the trees seemed to sing a lullaby, calming my mind.

meanings.sent1: The choir will sing at the concert next week.
meanings.sent2: She will sing her favorite ballad at the talent show.
meanings.sent3: I can't wait to sing 'Happy Birthday' to you in front of everyone!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to sing out the emotions he couldn't express otherwise.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashing against the shore seemed to sing a haunting melody.

meanings.definition: To produce musical tones by means of the voice
meanings.sent1: He can sing high notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The opera singer can sing in multiple languages with ease.
meanings.sent3: I tried to sing like a professional, but it just sounded like a cat meowing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to sing with emotion as she belted out the final note.
meanings.sent5: The violin and cello seemed to sing together in perfect harmony.
